nl: Let $E$ be a bounded set in $R^{1}$. Prove that there exists a real function $f$ such that $f$ is uniformly continuous and is not bounded on $E$.
lean:
∀ (E : Set ℝ) (h : Bornology.IsBounded E) :
  ∃ f, ℝ → ℝ, UniformContinuousOn f E ∧ ¬ Bornology.IsBounded (Set.image f E)
candidate: ∀ [EMetricSpace ℝ] {E : Set ℝ} : ∃ (f, ℝ → ℝ), UniformContinuous f ∧ ¬BddAbove (f '' E)
imports:
import Mathlib

open Topology Filter Real Complex TopologicalSpace Finset
open scoped BigOperators
